name: transport, freight, aircraft with reefer, freezing | transport, freight, aircraft with reefer, freezing | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14343/documentation

This dataset represent transport of reefer (refrigerated container) on a freight plane. The operation mode of the reefer is freezing (temperature between -35°C and -18°C).;The amount of operation of the reefer needed is calculated using the assumption of the average speed of the plane.;Reefer transported by plane (http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Unloading_JAL_747.jpg, accessed 20141217);Transport of food by plane is by far the most expensive type of transport with the highest environmental impact. There are several types of food which has high value and short duration of freshness and thus are usually being transported by plane. These foods are for example flowers, seafood, some pharmaceutical products, papaya and strawberries. 

This dataset simply combine two other activities - transport, freight, aircraft and operation of reefer, For more information on these two activities please see the datasets representing these two activities.
category: H:Transportation and storage/51:Air transport/512:Freight air transport/5120:Freight air transport

exchanges.description:
Calculated value based on estimated speed of the plane.

While the reefers for planes are quite specific (very light and much smaller than the big 40-foot, high-cube reefer) it is estimated, that the impacts of the operation of both of the reefers are very similar. Thus the operation of the traditional 40-foot, HC container is assumed to be adequate proxy for the specific container used in transport by plane.
